result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Daniel Smith

records.addlTxt: State's Discovery Demand

11:41 AM Defendant Joseph Daniel Smith in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Joseph Daniel Smith.  Attorney Kevin T Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Office M. Kraetke, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Mr. Schmidt rests.  Mr. Chapman has no cross.  No further witnesses. State asks Court to take judicial  notice of Polk County Case 21CF169 and bond & bond conditions.  No objection by Mr. Chapman.  Court does take judicial notice of the case and bond conditions.  Witness is released.  Venue is made.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information. Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Court notifies Def of right to speedy trial & jury trial.  Defense requests status.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Bond amended to account for the $500 additional cash that was previously posted on the defendant's behalf.  No additional cash must be posted at this time. 
 No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph Daniel Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Joseph Daniel Smith.  Def appears in custody, from Polk County Jail by video.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas to misdemeanors entered.  Court amends the cash bond to $750 as posted ($500 cash was held over from a dismissed case and another $250 cash had been posted).  Atty Chapman updates.  WTLPH.  Def likely to bond out soon and return to programming.  Bond continues as amended.  New bond will be sent for signature.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
